com.github.qacore.seleniumtestingtoolbox.webdriver

Interface AugmentedSelect<T extends org.openqa.selenium.WebElement>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Element type.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AugmentedWebElement
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultAugmentedWebElement

    public interface AugmentedSelect<T extends org.openqa.selenium.WebElement>
    AugmentedSelect interface makes a protocol for all kind of select elements (standard html and custom model).
    Since:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Leonardo Carmona da Silva
    • https://br.linkedin.com/in/l3ocarmona
    • https://github.com/leocarmona
    • lcdesenv@gmail.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void deselectAll()
      Clear all selected entries.
      void deselectByIndex(int index)
      Deselect the option at the given index.
      void deselectByValue(java.lang.String value)
      Deselect all options that have a value matching the argument.
      void deselectByVisibleText(java.lang.String text)
      Deselect all options that display text matching the argument.

    • Method Detail

      • isMultiple

        boolean isMultiple()
        Returns:
        Whether this select element support selecting multiple options at the same time? This is done by checking the value of the "multiple" attribute.

      • getOptions

        java.util.List<T> getOptions()
        Returns:
        All options belonging to this select tag

      • getAllSelectedOptions

        java.util.List<T> getAllSelectedOptions()
        Returns:
        All selected options belonging to this select tag

      • getFirstSelectedOption

        T getFirstSelectedOption()
        Returns:
        The first selected option in this select tag (or the currently selected option in a normal select)

      • selectByVisibleText

        void selectByVisibleText(java.lang.String text)
        Select all options that display text matching the argument. That is, when given "Bar" this would select an option like: <option value="foo">Bar</option>
        Parameters:
        text - The visible text to match against

      • selectByIndex

        void selectByIndex(int index)
        Select the option at the given index. This is done by examining the "index" attribute of an element, and not merely by counting.
        Parameters:
        index - The option at this index will be selected

      • selectByValue

        void selectByValue(java.lang.String value)
        Select all options that have a value matching the argument. That is, when given "foo" this would select an option like: <option value="foo">Bar</option>
        Parameters:
        value - The value to match against

      • deselectAll

        void deselectAll()
        Clear all selected entries. This is only valid when the SELECT supports multiple selections.

      • deselectByValue

        void deselectByValue(java.lang.String value)
        Deselect all options that have a value matching the argument. That is, when given "foo" this would deselect an option like: <option value="foo">Bar</option>
        Parameters:
        value - The value to match against

      • deselectByIndex

        void deselectByIndex(int index)
        Deselect the option at the given index. This is done by examining the "index" attribute of an element, and not merely by counting.
        Parameters:
        index - The option at this index will be deselected

      • deselectByVisibleText

        void deselectByVisibleText(java.lang.String text)
        Deselect all options that display text matching the argument. That is, when given "Bar" this would deselect an option like: <option value="foo">Bar</option>
        Parameters:
        text - The visible text to match against
